Close it off, and voila: two independent homes under one roof. Perfect for multigenerational living or Airbnb gold in touristy Bisbee. Bonus Fun Zones: A dedicated indoor workshop/creative space for your DIY dreams, and a game room(or extra bedroom/office/2nd living room) that's begging for ping-pong/pool tournaments, movie nights, or whatever shenanigans you cook up. Outdoor Oasis: Huge front yard - 3-car carport and covered patio with a romantic swing overlooking the mountains and the beautiful colors of Old Bisbee. That's just the start of the magic at this charming 1905 two-story gem - a historic home that's equal parts cozy retreat, adventure pad, and income opportunity! Old Bisbee Craftsman 2 bedroom 1 bath and garage parking for 1. Just a few stairs to the front door. New AC, water heater, gas stove and dishwasher. text: Enchanting SOLAR Historic Hilltop Retreat with Guest House in Old Bisbee. Perched on a scenic hill in the heart of historic Old Bisbee, this exquisitely restored property blends timeless charm with modern luxury. It offers panoramic views of downtown Bisbee's colorful rooftops and the dramatic mountainous landscape, including an unobstructed view of the iconic ''B'' Mountain! With wrap-around patios and multi-level decks framing every vista, this hilltop sanctuary is a masterpiece of serenity and style, perfect for those seeking an artist's haven or a unique HIGH desert escape. MAIN RESIDENCE: Timeless Elegance Meets Modern Comfort. The main home features 1 spacious bedroom with hand-painted wall covering, a half-bathroom, and French doors onto the porch with a lovely view of the valley ... Complemented by a grand great room that seamlessly integrates a fun & fabulous kitchen with a breakfast bar and a cozy dining area. An additional room offers flexibility as a spacious 2nd bedroom (no closet), den, office, or extra living space. A beautifully appointed bathroom, thoughtfully expanded, blends historic character with contemporary upgrades. Original hardwood floors and distressed Bisbee wood paneling whisper tales of the town's colorful past, harmonizing with modern enhancements like dual-pane windows, updated electrical and plumbing systems, and maintenance-free weatherproof (Trex) decking. With sweeping 360 degree unobstructed views that make it feel like you're in the middle of heaven, this steel structure home is ideally situated: close enough to Bisbee and the highway to make town access easy and fast, but far enough away to not hear any traffic. Situated on a dead-end road, it gets very little traffic and provides a tone of privacy. The home is approx 1,050 sqft, built from two extremely heavy duty steel frame building structures, with a lofted roof, open floorplan, and incredible views from every area. Current framing is for 1 bedroom suite with bathroom, an office or bedroom can be easily added. Power is 100% solar from existing solar panels, and purchase price will include 10 server rack battery, split across tow independent power systems and lines. 1 line and set of batteries supplies the power to the home. The other solar system is intended to be dedicated to 2 mini split air conditioning units, so that air conditioning does not reduce the amount of power available to the rest of the home. 240 volt appliances such as washer dryer can be accommodated. Property includes a certified septic system that has never been used. Water comes from rain catchment from the main roof of the house, and includes two 2,500 gallons cisterns. Additional roof surfaces and rain gutters can easily allow expansion with an additional cistern. The two large cisterns feed into an enclosed water filtration shed that has 3 stage filtration and a brand new propane powered on-demand hot water heater. Includes a brand new 32' x 16 foot workshop and a very large "garageport" - a multi-function space for primary vehicle storage, a secure tool room, 2 solar utility closets, a large workbench and plenty of storage and shelving. There is also a new 2nd carport, currently being used as a "tractorport" for tractor and ATV (both are for sales as personal property available separate from this listing). Current owner is continuing to build the property, landscape, and finish the interior of the main home, and price will rise as it nears completion, so hurry to get a lower price with more customizability. Also available are two adjoining parcels of land purchased to maintain views and act as buffer from any disturbances, these are available at a discount, so the entire package could be up to 31 acres. Manicured walking trails have been created for you and your dogs, so you can stroll the property and enjoy the land easily. The slope of the land and distance from any large washes means monsoon drainage is not a problem, but grey water / water retention basins have been started, so when you plant shade trees, they can be maintained by nature and bathroom shower and laundry drainage. With a strong down payment, current owner is willing to finance the balance on flexible terms. And if you need a temporary home while you complete this one, seller has an air conditioned 28' tiny home on wheels that is on-site for separate purchase under flexible terms. In short, everything the seller owns including tools and tractor,

text: The Million Dollar View From Shadow Ridge/Written By Owner. It is an easy walk to the top of the world, if you already live there. That is what it is like on Shadow Ridge, two side-by-side 40 acre parcels of high desert land, situated on the southern slopes of Barrett Peak, the Mule Mountain Range's tallest mountain. Nestled a mile high in southeast Arizona's Sky Island Region, the ranch is sometimes surrounded by low-lying clouds and becomes an island in the sky. As one approaches the ranch, one passes the pyramid palatial Wick estate. Then while driving through a forest of oaks, one passes the fallen ruins of an old miner's shack. Once at the property, you look out across southeastern Arizona and northern Mexico, forever stretching before your gaze.

You can look down on every thing from the top of this Hills Spectacular Building site. 40 acres, located in the Coveted Red Mountain Road area near Bisbee AZ. The Seller has Built a Drive able Road that will take you right to the top to the most spectacular view.

text: The Million Dollar View From Shadow Ridge/Written By Owner. It is an easy walk to the top of the world, if you already live there. That is what it is like on Shadow Ridge, two side-by-side 40 acre parcels of high desert land, situated on the southern slopes of Barrett Peak, the Mule Mountain Range's tallest mountain. Nestled a mile high in southeast Arizona's Sky Island Region, the ranch is sometimes surrounded by low-lying clouds and becomes an island in the sky. As one approaches the ranch, one passes the pyramid palatial Wick estate. Then while driving through a forest of oaks, one passes the fallen ruins of an old miner's shack. Once at the property, you look out across southeastern Arizona and northern Mexico, forever stretching before your gaze. The sunsets from the property are purely spectacular! The morning sunrises cast a large shadow on the slopes of the ranch's high ridge. Wildlife, flora, deer and other fauna abound. There are oak and ocotillo forests, tall grass meadows, agave, yucca and wildflowers galore, a hard-rock natural amphitheater nearly the size of a football field, tree-laden arroyos, and dramatic and amazing cliffs. The East property line is adjacent to National Forest land. It is a nature lover's/survivalist's dream come true. During the monsoon rainy season of Summer it is frequently cool. Sometimes there are flowing streams that begin on the property where water springs from the earth. And sometimes there are incredibly beautiful cascades of water that form desert waterfalls. The unfinished Building is currently a 20' x 40' x 12' high stucco building. It has 8 sliding glass doors/windows that look graciously and generously upon the surrounding beauty and western panoramas. There are also 3 swinging doors and other windows. Agents Note- There is a lot of finish and clean up needed on this building, no Septic, no Water and no Power available.
